text: The Kilwa sharp-snouted worm lizard (Ancylocranium ionidesi) is a worm lizard species in the family Amphisbaenidae. It is endemic to Tanzania. ==Etymology== The specific name, ionidesi, is in honor of British game warden Constantine John Philip Ionides (1901–1968), who was known as the "Snake Man of British East Africa"..Beolens, Bo; Watkins, Michael; Grayson, Michael (2011). The Eponym Dictionary of Reptiles. Baltimore: Johns Hopkins University Press. xiii + 296 pp. . (Ancylcranium ionidesi, p. 130). ==References== Category:Ancylocranium Category:Reptiles described in 1955 Category:Endemic fauna of Tanzania Category:Reptiles of Tanzania Category:Taxa named by Arthur Loveridge
title: Kilwa sharp-snouted worm lizard
